page.title: 05THE NEW BIELD AT LYVEDEN 1
page.content:
{THE HISTORY OF THE NEW BIELD } The New Bield at Lyveden was built by Sir Thomas Tresham (1545-1605) as a garden house for the manor of Lyveden, the manor house (known as the Old Bield) which was rebuilt by Sir Thomas, and his second son Sir Lewis Tresham,first Bart. It is a cruciform building of stone,and measures some 70ft square. It stands on a hill. The theme of the building is the Passion and Death of Our Lord. It was begun in 1594, and the work proceeded slowly. The house was surrounded by elaborate gardens. Work on the house was going on in 1599, but received a check when Sir Thomas was imprisoned in 1600.
